channel.title: Going to work
channel.description:
In about 10 minutes I'm about to go to work with my father, he is a truck driver and asked me if I wanted to go for the day.
So my question is, Have you ever gone to work with your mum or dad? If so, to what job? If not, would you?

item.title: Going to work
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Umm, I’ve went to work with my dad back when I was 7 or 8 years old at a bowling alley. I was related to the manager as well. I always got free change to go play games, and if there was a lane open, he would turn it on so I could bowl lol. Was great, did that many times.

Read full topic

item.title: Going to work
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I think when I was really young I went with my dad once. He practically runs a window company, so he just sat on the computer budgeting most of the time iirc.

My mom’s a nurse on a hotline type deal so going there would be pretty boring unless I could hear the calls.

Read full topic

item.title: Going to work
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Yes, my father brought me to work with him when I was 11, he owned 3 plastics company’s and the man could litterly do anything from paper work to full on fixing the machines.

Read full topic

item.title: Going to work
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“ww3, post:33, topic:428767”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=531462.msg3883737#msg3883737 date=1326254976]

My dads a tow truck driver and it was very exciting going around to car crashes

With dead babies all over the place? Yer, i like them too.

Which bring me to my next comment, I went shopping with my mum and she randomly says ‘Move would you! I hate running over children’.
[/quote]Amy, That will be my job doing being an EMT/Firefighter. We normally get the mess cleaned up before he would get there o.o

You would be supprised[/quote]I know there are times that you get on the scene before hand. But normally it shouldn’t happen.

Read full topic

item.title: Going to work
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:24, topic:428767”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=531462.msg3883691#msg3883691 date=1326251461]
I’ve worked with both my mom and dad, and I worked for myself…

My mom is the dean of international education and the directory of international systems of the Seattle community college district… she spends most of the day replying to emails and going to meetings. My dad is the IT guy for our church, he does different stuff every day

When I worked myself, it was at Seattle Pacific University in the Computer Information Systems department
[/quote]I thought you lived on the east coast :|[/quote]What? My location has always been Washington on my profile And I’ve always said I live near Seattle (specifically Kent)

Read full topic

item.title: Going to work
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Well for the first couple of hours it was fun, because it was dark. Then it became light and i haven’t slept since 12 pm yestersay, so it was kinda shit. Just sat there listening to music and watching the world around me, that was good because i life traveling in cars when i don’t have ot drive them. Also i have a few clips of one load, maybe 15 mins long if you guys want to watch it i’ll post it, otherwise i’ll just put it in my files. Got a cool picture of a detailed truck, that’s worth seeing but the video would basically just show you what Australia (Victoria) looks like.

Read full topic

item.title: Going to work
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

My dad is the Manager of the Derpartment of Management at Petroglyph National Monument here near where I live. Its quite interesting because there are dormant volcanoes here and there is a 17 mile long escarpment of volcanic rock that as indian pictures “petroglyphs” to “communicate” with their spirits. In general though, the geological, geographical and historic parts of the part is quite fascinating. I have volunteered there since i was 8 and I am about to be highered working for my dad at $11.50 an hour 8 hours a day for the whole 3 month summer.

Read full topic

item.title: Going to work
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I’ve been stuck at my moms workplace for 6 or 7 hours. She’s an ER nurse and within the first 30 minutes of me being there I witnessed some crazy naked old man run down the hall and shit on himself. Fuck that career.

Read full topic

item.title: Going to work
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

I thought you could delete posts.

Anyways, I go with my dad to the car dealership he works at and clean the floors in the mechanics’ shop. Makes $50 flat, which I use to pay my phone bill normally. Its also pretty easy, my job is just to sweep water out of the area :rolleyes: I also get to see the Mopar label just about everywhere I look aside from the heater in there.

Read full topic
